result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Orlando C Robinson

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:23 AM Defendant Orlando C Robinson not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Theresa Fallon Villar in court for the State of Wisconsin. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
BTC: No appearance, Bench Warrant requested/ordered, bond forfeited. - stay 24 hrs.

BACK ON THE RECORD 9:54 AM -
Orlando Robinson now appears in person in court, all other appearances remain the same.
BTC: VACATE WARRANT, reinstate bond.
State has filed an amended complaint on 8-8-22.
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, not guilty plea entered.
Deft has gone to the SPD's office but is not eligible.
Court appointed atty info given to the deft.
BTC: Matter adjourned.
copy of letter from State Public Defender - not eligible
State's Notice of Intent to introduce certified public records w/o extrinsic evidence
State's Notice of Intent to use videotaped statements of a child under 12
State's Notice of Intent to introduce Deft's Statements
State's Notice of Intent to introduce 911 recordings
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE
Racine County Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. No contact with the victim V.V (person, property, residence or family).

2:07 PM Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Orlando C Robinson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Sophia Dolan appeared by video for Orlando C Robinson. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Initial appearance on August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
